answers.answer: That really stinks! How often were you eating sweets?
ALOT! You know I was looking at the diabetic diet and it really is not that bad. I will adjust. I think the worst part is pricking the fingers! I have to meet with a dietician next week.

Sorry to hear your news. On the bright side, gestational diabetes almost always goes away after delivery! One more bright note-by eating healthier stuff now, you are prepping yourself for taking off those post-partum pounds!How's that for silver lining:)Take care of yourself!

They have meters now that you can do on your forearm or thigh...they really don't hurt at all and I'm a big baby :o)As for the comment posted about getting back in shape.  I had to have a C-section and the pain meds they gave me have completely suppressed my apetite.  I guess that is a good thing since I put on 55 pounds :o) I was STARVING all throughout my pregnancy.Good luck to you.

Hey its not so bad  My last 8 weeks they diagnosed me tooIts the first 2 weeks that are the worst, just getting to know what you can have and how much  its amazing really just how many foods contain sugar, carrots, peas, things that you think are good for you.As for pricking your finger  it doesnt hurt  the glucose monitors are set you just place on your finger and push the button it happens so fast it is done in no time.As for your baby the only risk really is big baby  and maybe diabetic  which they will test when you have your baby the first few feedings  they ***** his\her heel   but my boy was only 7 lbs 1 oz so thats not biganyway good luck

I decided to go for a repeat c section.  My Dh's work schedule is so bad right now that he can't commit to get out on time to go to chilbirth classes and I have no other person to be my coach. My mother is almost wheelchair bound  :(AND After speaking to my ex husband he basically tells me that he will be unavailable to get my 6yo DS to and from school etc during labor/childbirth. He can't take time off or take 1/2 days, etc.  Have I mentioned he can be an a*shole ??I have no other family around me and my friends all have kids and live around 45 mins away. So they aren't an option to helping me.
wisegirl- yes you certainly do get to gain more!!! sheesh- can't believe a doctor told you that.
Wll, they say eating sugar does not cause it. So try not to worry!

Oh Yeah !  At my dr's appt today they told me not to gain anymore weight. I've gained 24# so far, so I went from 115# to 139#.  Is this dr f'ing kidding me ??  I was 5-10# UNDERWEIGHT at the start AND quit smoking ! Don't I get to gain a little more than average ??
I'm worried now! I have a terrible sweet tooth :o(

I can totally see why you would go repeat c-section. it certainly makes the planning a little easier when you have another child at home, doesn't it? I hope you have lots of support during RECOVERY from your surgery, though!I am shocked that your Dr would suggest you not gain any more weight. I have read that when you are on the underweight side (and at 5,10, your BMI would have been LOW) 35-45 is the norm.I was average weight with my first, gained 37 pounds, and my Dr told me that was just lovely (although I can't say I felt lovely!:). Continue to eat healthy, and your body will gain what it needs to support your baby.Would it be fair to say that your Dr is a little older? Seems pretty "old school" to me. I think my Mom was told to gain 15 pounds or something foolish. HA!
That's crazy!  I was told that the last month or two you will gain weight even quicker but that the weight is basically going right to the baby.  How can your doctor expect you to not gain anymore?

I know what that feels like.  I'm presently 5 weeks pregnant and AM on insulin now for the duration of my pregnancy.  It definately takes alot of coaching and talking to yourself when you have to inject yourself 4 times a day and ***** your finger another 4 times.  I know that eventually I'll get used to giving myself insulin.  I know that poking your finger is scary.  I still remember the first week of doing it.  Just remember, it's what you baby needs to survive or just stay healthy.  Best of luck and stay strong///June

question: I just got back from doc office. I took my 3 hour glucose test the other day and I failed it! It's official, I have gestational diabetes. She said it was not too terribly high and should be managed fine with diet. No Sweets! O my lord! The thing that bothers me the most is having to ***** my finger 4 times a day. Ouch! I guess it could be worse. Everything else looked great! So if I can just get through the next 10 or 11 weeks. Danielle
title: Not very happy right now
